data.title: Usher (Singer)
data.meta_description: Rose to fame in the late 1990s with the release of his second album "My Way". His 2004 album, "Confessions", sold over 20 million copies...
data.text:
Full Name: Usher Terry Raymond IV

Profession: Singer

Biography: Rose to fame in the late 1990s with the release of his second album "My Way".

His 2004 album, "Confessions", sold over 20 million copies worldwide, and established him as one of the best-selling musical artist of the 2000s decade.

Born: October 14, 1978

Birthplace: Dallas, Texas, USA

Age: 45 years old

Generation: Generation X

Chinese Zodiac: Horse

Star Sign: Libra

Married Life

American singer-songwriter Usher (28) weds hair stylist and wardrobe stylist Tameka Foster (37) at Chateau Elan Winery and Resort in Georgia; divorce in 2009

R&B singer Usher (30) divorces hair stylist and wardrobe stylist Tameka Foster (38) due to irretrievably broken marriage after 2 years

American R&B singer Usher (45) weds third wife, long-time partner and American music industry executive Jenn Goicoechea (40) at Vegas Weddings, Las Vegas, hours after he performs at the Super Bowl half time show

Historical Events

"Yeah!" single released by Usher featuring Lil Jon and Ludacris (Grammy Award Best Rap/Sung Collaboration 2005, Billboard Song of the Year 2004)

Usher releases his 4th studio album "Confessions" (2004 Billboard Album of the Year, Grammy Award Best Contemporary R&B Album 2005)

21st MTV Video Music Awards: OutKast, Beyonc√© & Usher featuring Lil Jon & Ludacris win

32nd American Music Awards: Sheryl Crow, Usher & Kenny Chesney win

15th Billboard Music Awards: Usher, Alicia Keys, and Toby Keith win

19th Soul Train Music Awards: Ice Cube, Usher & Ciara win

53rd Grammy Awards: "Need You Now"; Esperanza Spalding; Lady Gaga; Usher; Jeff Beck win

Usher performs the halftime show at Super Bowl LVIII with guests Alicia Keys, will.i.am, Lil Jon, H.E.R. and Ludacris

Biographies and Sources

Usher and longtime partner married in Las Vegas after Super Bowl half-time show - Guardian

Usher joined by Alicia Keys, Lil Jon, Ludacris and more during Super Bowl LVIII halftime show - NBC News
